etymology.description: 网(网) (wǎng, "net") + 維(維) (wéi, "bird (tied with string)") = net for catching birds -> trapping or a net
etymology.interpretation: The character 羅(羅) (luó, "to net") intuitively combines the concept of a net 网(网) (wǎng) with 維(維) (wéi, "bird (tied with string)") to visually represent a tool designed for trapping or catching, similar to a bird snare.
etymology.simplification: 羅(羅) was simplified to 罗(罗) by replacing 維(維) with 夕(夕) (xī, "evening") as a more streamlined form.

examples.chinese: 渔夫用网罗鱼(漁夫用網羅魚)。
猎人精心布置陷阱(獵人精心佈置陷阱)，罗捕野兔(羅捕野兔)。
examples.pinyin: Lièrén jīngxīn bùzhì xiànjǐng, luó bǔ yětù.
examples.english: The hunter carefully sets traps, netting wild rabbits.

examples.chinese: 渔船扬帆出海(漁船揚帆出海)，罗捕群鱼(羅捕羣魚)。
examples.pinyin: Yúchuán yángfān chūhǎi, luó bǔ qúnyú.
examples.english: The fishing boat sets sail, netting a school of fish.
